section.title: lms.djangoapps.mobile_api.apps module
section.paragraph: Configuration for the mobile_api Django application.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: AppConfig
Configuration class for the mobile_api Django application.
Configuration context for django templates.
Method decorator for a mobile API endpoint that verifies the user has access to the course in a mobile context.
Function and class decorator that abstracts the authentication and permission checks for mobile api views.

section.title: lms.djangoapps.mobile_api.errors module
section.paragraph: List of errors that can be returned by the mobile api

desc_content.paragraph: Converts an error_code and message into a response body
Bases: MiddlewareMixin
Middleware class to keep track of mobile application version being used.
Processes request to validate app version that is making request.

field_body.paragraph: Http response with status code 426 (i.e. Update Required) if request is from mobile native app and app version is no longer supported else returns None

desc_content.paragraph: If request is from mobile native app, then add version related info to response headers.

list_item.paragraph: EDX-APP-LATEST-VERSION; if user app version < latest available version
EDX-APP-VERSION-LAST-SUPPORTED-DATE; if user app version < min supported version and timestamp < expiry of that version

section.title: lms.djangoapps.mobile_api.mobile_platform module
section.paragraph: Platform related Operations for Mobile APP

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: MobilePlatform
Android platform
Bases: MobilePlatform
iOS platform
Replaces build number(3172) with app version(2.26.3) and Returns platform instance if user_agent matches with USER_AGENT_REGEX

list_item.paragraph: user_agent (str) user-agent for mobile app making the request.
user_agent_regex (regex str) Regex for user-agent valid for any type pf mobile platform.

field_body.paragraph: An instance of class passed (which would be one of the supported mobile platform classes i.e. PLATFORM_CLASSES) if user_agent matches regex of that class else returns None

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: object
MobilePlatform class creates an instance of platform based on user agent and supports platform related operations.
It creates an instance of one of the supported mobile platforms (i.e. iOS, Android) by regex comparison of user-agent.

field_body.paragraph: instance of one of the supported mobile platforms (i.e. iOS, Android)

desc_content.paragraph: Returns platform instance if user_agent matches with USER_AGENT_REGEX

list_item.paragraph: user_agent (str) user-agent for mobile app making the request.
user_agent_regex (regex str) Regex for user-agent valid for any type pf mobile platform.

field_body.paragraph: An instance of class passed (which would be one of the supported mobile platform classes i.e. PLATFORM_CLASSES) if user_agent matches regex of that class else returns None
